title: Textile (USA), 1924
medium:
Medium: wool, cotton
Technique: a closer weave is used for trees, birds, and figures. Both top and bottom edges finished by machine stitching. A brick repeat of more-or-less square pattern unit. A brick repeat of more-or-less square pattern unit.
dimensions: Warp x Weft (selvage to selvage): 15.6 x 12 cm (6 1/8 x 4 3/4 in.)
description: Length of upholstery fabric with exotic and stylized floral vines in green, pale blue, pink, grey, yellow, brown and white framing male and female figures under a tree in one row. Both figures hold bows and wear crosses. Male wears a quiver of arrows on his back; female wears crown of leaves. Black background.
